submission:
class Solution:
    # i-1        ,    i
    # k               j
    # nums[i-1]-k, nums[i]-j
    # dp[i][j] = sum dp[i-1][k] for nums[i-1]-k >= nums[i]-j and k <= j
    # k <= j+nums[i-1]-nums[i] and k <= j
    
    # 2  3  2
    #       0  1  2  3
    #dp: 0: 1  1  1  0
    #    1: 0  1  2  3
    #    2: 0  1  3  0
    def countOfPairs(self, nums: List[int]) -> int:
        n = len(nums)
        ma = max(nums)
        dp = [[0 for i in range(ma+1)] for j in range(n)]
        for i in range(ma+1):
            dp[0][i] = 1 if i <= nums[0] else 0
            
        for i in range(1, n):
            for j in range(nums[i] + 1):
                k = min(j, j+nums[i-1]-nums[i])
                if k >= 0:
                    dp[i][j] = sum(dp[i-1][0:k+1])
                # print(i, j, dp[i][j])
                    
        M = int(1e9+7)
        return sum(dp[-1]) % M
